text: Tetrahydrofurfuryl acetate is an organic chemical compound used for food flavouring and cosmetics. It has a fruity ethereal flavour, also described as honey, maple, or bread-like. It is generally accepted as safe in the USA. Typical levels of use are 2 ppm in drinks, 8 ppm in icecream, and 20 ppm in baked products and confectionery. Classified as a heterocyclic ester, it is made by reacting tetrahydrofurfuryl alcohol with acetic anhydride. Related flavouring compounds are tetrahydrofurfuryl butyrate, tetrahydrofurfuryl cinnamate, tetrahydrofurfuryl alcohol, and tetrahydrofurfuryl propionate. ==References== Category:Food additives Category:Flavors Category:Tetrahydrofurans Category:Acetate esters
title: Tetrahydrofurfuryl acetate
